title: Telecom Italia returns to growth, claims turnround ‘proceeding quickly’
body:
Telecom Italia has returned to growth in the third quarter after posting a 1.4 per cent rise in revenue to €4.8bn and an 8.5 per cent increase in earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortisation.

The revenue performance followed a 12 per cent drop in the first quarter of the year followed by a near 8 per cent decline in the second. The rebound was driven by its business unit, which achieved its best quarterly results since 2007, and its Brazilian operations, writes Nic Fildes.

Giuseppe Recchi, executive chairman of Telecom Italia, said:

The turnaround is proceeding quickly, with results ahead of expectations.

The company kept its guidance for low single digit organic Ebitda growth in its home market steady.

Exane BNP analysts said:

Group revenues and group EBITDA are respectively 1.9% and 2.6% above consensus expectations.The company says it remains on track to deliver its EUR1.6bn cost cutting plan by 2018.

Shares dropped 2 per cent following the results with the stock down 36 per cent from the start of the year.
opening: Telecom Italia has returned to growth in the third quarter after posting a 1.4 per cent rise in revenue to €4.8bn and an 8.5 per cent increase in earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortisation.
